calico noun
(CLOTH)

[ U ] UK a heavy plain cloth made from cotton: Hospitalized servicemen wore an approximation of uniform in blue calico. a calico shopping bag
Kameleon007/iStock / Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
[ U ] US cotton cloth with a printed pattern: His shirt, jacket, and trousers were of striped calico. I found a picture of my grandmother in a calico dress.

calico noun
(CAT)
[ C ] US (also calico cat); (UK tortoiseshell and white cat, tortie and white) a cat with white, black, brown, and orange fur: We've had three cats in our married life, and we have a calico now. A small calico cat was sitting on the windowsill above the kitchen sink. Compare
tabby
tortoiseshell
More examplesFewer examplesThe cat was a calico named CC.I have one cat that is a calico, and I have one that has long black-and-white hair.Generally, cloned animals look identical, but calicos are a strange exception. Having the same DNA as another calico cat does not always produce the same coat pattern.
